node.title: Miramax sues Tarantino over planned Pulp Fiction NFTs
node.alt: A woman with short black hair and a short fringe sits at a retro-style diner booth drinking a vanilla milkshake
node.description: The lawsuit filed by production company Miramax asks a judge to forbid director Quentin Tarantino from selling seven Pulp Fiction NFTs and any similar violation of their copyright, while also requesting he pay all legal costs.
node.content:
["Production company Miramax has filed a lawsuit against director Quentin Tarantino over his\u00a0plans to create and auction off a series of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) based on his work on Pulp Fiction.", "The company alleges Mr Tarantino's planned offerings violate the copyright\u00a0it holds to the director's 1994 film, according to the lawsuit filed in a US federal court in Los Angeles.", "Mr Tarantino recently announced plans to sell seven NFTs \u2014 which are digital works rendered unique and attached to a specific owner \u2014 through cryptocurrency technology.", "The NFTs due to go on sale next month include scanned digital copies of handwritten script pages for uncut versions of scenes from the film, with audio commentary and other elements.", "Each will also include \"secret\" aspects, accessible only to the owner.", "The company said they were forced to act in order to preserve the film's copyright.\u00a0", "\"Tarantino's conduct has forced Miramax to bring this lawsuit against a valued collaborator in order to enforce, preserve\u00a0and protect its contractual and intellectual property rights relating to one of Miramax's most iconic and valuable film properties,\" it said.\u00a0", "\"Left unchecked, Tarantino's conduct could mislead others into believing Miramax is involved in his venture.", "Mr Tarantino did not reply to a request for comment.\u00a0", "According to the lawsuit, Mr Tarantino's attorneys responded to cease-and-desist letters from Miramax by saying the sales fall under the partial rights he held from the production, including the rights to screenplay publication.", "Miramax's lawsuit asks a judge to forbid sale of the NFTs and any similar violation of its\u00a0copyright, and asks for Mr Tarantino to pay its legal fees and any related costs.", "Pulp Fiction \u2014\u00a0the 1994 film starring Samuel L. Jackson, Uma Thurman and John Travolta \u2014\u00a0took Mr Tarantino from touted indie director to major filmmaking star.", "It was one of several films he made with Miramax, which was then helmed by brothers Harvey and Bob Weinstein.", "", "
Miramax is suing Quentin Tarantino over plans to create and auction several\u00a0NFTs from his work on Pulp Fiction.(AP: Invision/Vianney Le Caer/File)
", "AP"]
